verses.verse: Now I, Paul myself, who am insignificant in person, but when absent am assertive towards you, plead with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ.
I plead with you, so that when I am present, I won't have to be bold by the kind of confidence by which I plan to use against those who think we are walking according to the flesh.
For though we do walk in the flesh, we do not make war according to the flesh.
For the weapons we use for war are not of the flesh but mighty through to even pulling down strong holds.
We destroy arguments and every high, self-exalted opinion against the knowledge of God, and bringing every thought captive to the obedience of Christ.
Having a readiness to punish all disobedience after your obedience is complete.
Are you looking at the outward appearance? If any one is confident that he is Christ's, then let him remind himself that as he is Christ's so are we.
For even if I brag a little too much about our authority, which the Lord has given to us for edification and not for your destruction, I am not ashamed,
so that I wouldn't look like I'm trying to scare you by my letters.
"For his letters," he says, "are impressive and forceful, but his physical presence is weak and speech despicable."
Let this person think about this: that as we are in the words of our letter when we are absent, so we will be in what we do when we are present.
We don't dare judge ourselves to be that way or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves, but they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves to themselves. They are not wise.
We will not brag beyond limits but according to the measure of the rule that God has distributed to us--a measure that reaches even you,
for we are not overextending ourselves as if we didn't reach you, for we did come all the way to you also in [preaching] the Gospel of Christ.
We are not bragging excessively about other men's hard work but having--as your faith increases--hope to greatly increase our sphere of influence among you,
to preach the Gospel in areas beyond you, but not to brag about another man's already accomplished work.
Now the one who glories, let him glory in the Lord.
The one who brags about himself is not approved, but the one the Lord commends.
